Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into four registers: 1 - Scene of offerings and a figure cutting meat. 2 - Scene of the deceased and wife receiving offerings. 3 - Agricultural scene. 4 - Twelve lines of incised Hieroglyphic text.
Curator's comments: Published: PM V: pp. 95-96. Translation: R O Faulknner, 'The stela of Rudjahau'. JEA 37 (1951), 47-52. Lichtheim, Ancient Egyptian Autobiographies (OBO 84): p.70-72
Bibliographic references: Scott-Moncrieff 1911 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 1. (pl.42-43)
